text: Deze authentieke toren is prachtig gerestaureerd, met dank aan een subsidie uit Portugal. Vanaf deze toren heb je een prachtig uitzicht op de haven van Mindelo. De lokale bevolking legt er een kaartje en op de rand bij het strand wordt de versgevangen vis schoon gemaakt.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Digna de ver
text: Es uno de los lugares de más interés de Lisboa.Las vistas son espectaculares puesto que está en plena mar.se divisa el oceanográfico y otros lugares de interés como el monumento a la reconquista

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Très décevant
text: On a mis du temps à comprendre ce que c’était tellement elle est petite! (Surtout quand on a vu la tour de Bélèm du Portugal). En plus de cela, impossible de monter à l’intérieur malgré que nous étions dans les heures d’ouvertures: une vraie déception! Aucune raison de se déplacer pour cela!

text: Just a copy of the Belem Tour of Lisboa, nothing special here. It is close to the sea and the city center.

text: Am besten macht sich der Torre de Belem als Hintergrund für ein Hafenfoto. Auf dem Weg zum Fischmarkt kommt man direkt daran vorbei. Es lohnt sich jedoch nicht, extra wegen diesem Gebäude nach Mindelo zu kommen.

text:
zeer oud geëtaleerd. niet alles in het Engels vertaald. Zit weinig logica in, gaat met name over de walvisvangst. 
Gebouw zelf is meer de moeite waard dan het museum gehalte.
Bovenop de toren kun je mooi over Mindelo uitkijken, dat is wel de moeite waard.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Réplica pouco fiel
text:
Quem conhece a Torre de Belém fica muito decepcionado com esta réplica muito pouco fiel.
Infelizmente não tive tempo de visitar o museu.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Art Market & Souvenir shops
text: a lot of African souvenir, traditional shirt, handcraft, etc. also you can find ivory craft selling here, but please check is it original or may create by bone.

title: Art,  Pearls and handicraft.
text: If looking for semi precious stones,  Art and craft pearls.  This market has all.  Lots of Chinese tourists buying stuff around.  Shop keepers even speak the language.  Lots of bargaining can be done.  Stuff much cheaper than at hotels.

title: It was  splendid
text: I loved loved and loved every moment, stressful but worth it. Lekki Market is a beautiful place to be.

title: Amazing Handmade Crafts
text: If you are looking for some amazing African handmade statutes, figurines, paintings then this must be the place to visit. Parking may be a bit of an issue but if you go there with your driver, then that's sorted out. This is also the place to hone your haggling & bargaining abilities. The general rule of thumb is that you should get your selected item at 50% of the quoted price (if not less!!). This is the place to explore and look around. You'll find some amazing stuff here!!

title: Loads to choose from for self and presents.
text: Loads to choose from for self and presents. Arts, fabrics, brick a brace for all price ranges. A lovely covered market. Always with s visit whenever I go into Lekki.

title: Lekki Market: My View
text: I live in Lagos and I am Nigerian. This is a great market for getting some local art works from Nigeria especially those native to Lagos. However it is best visited with a local person. You must know how to bargain as prices tend to be highly over stated. Rule of thumb is to cut it down by 50% and maintain your stand know matter how much you want it. you can go lower too.never stop at a shop. go around the market to see other items you may just getter better stuffs. Do not try to visit this market whenever it rains.It will be like crossing the biblical red se.a. Try to get a little model of the old Lagos Danfo and other interesting artifacts. Just don't forget to ensure you head to the Lagos Museum to register the artifacts and get your export permit

title: Saturday exploring
text:
Stopped at the market for something to do. Nice range of produce, wooden carvings, bags and clothes. 
Was hard to get into as it had rained the night before. Hard to get there without a four wheel drive. 
All the people will try and pull you in their stalls so it can be a little overwhelming but worth a look

title: Great market for souvenirs
text: The Lekki market hosts several hundreds of souvenir stalls. Here you will find paintings, wood carvings, cloths and jewelry from Nigeria and neighbouring countries. The salesmen are not too pushy, but you have to bargain till you settle for about half the price initially asked for. All taxidrivers know the place so it shouldn't be difficult to be dropped there.

title: hard to find, bargain hard
text:
Road there goes through another local market - turn off Lekki Expressway between 4th and 5th roundabouts, just before the footbridge onto dirt road.  Take first left, go straight around 200m, then right.  Market is about 50m on the left - walk through the red buildings to get to the main market.

Negotiate hard - opening prices are 2-3 times high.

title: Interesting!
text: The Lekki Market is a bustling market where you can buy African arts & crafts as well as all sorts of curios. Nice place to visit

title: Hone your bargaining skills
text: The road in can be a challenge, particularly if it's been raining, but it's worth it when you get there.  A broad range of artworks and souvenirs including paintings, wood carvings (including masks), jewelery, wall hangings, and many more.  You'll definitely need to bargain hard, but if you're a practiced negotiator you can get some very good bargains.

title: Diversidade em artesanato
text:
Lá encontrei artesanato de vários países africanos além da Nigéria. Comprei toalhas de mesa lindas em Batik e vestidos também.
Há muita bijouteria e bolsas de couro de animais que morreram de doenças segundo eles dizem.

title: Conhecendo a Cultura local
text: O mercado de Lekki tem uma variedade de produtos locais, aconselho reservar dinheiro para comprar uma máscara de madeira, são magníficas. Mesmo se não for para fazer compras a visita vale muito!

title: Wonderful place for affordable indigenous art work
text:
Walking through the stalls was an interesting experience,thé various sculptures,oil & acrylic paintings,excellent wood work;you know the kind we had in our grandparents homes with intricately carved designs (some of which I had previously seen at named galleries with hefty price tags 😀).
An eye for quality artwork is necessary to avoid being hustled,and good bargaining skills too.All in all,it was a rewarding experience,I now visit often on the lookout for nice pieces to acquire for my home.

title: Authentic artisan market
text: This very authentic artisan market is a go-to place for anyone wanting some handcrafted souvenirs. There is a wide range of items. We went on a Sunday before noon so we were the first tourists there, but it picked up after an hour or so but it definitely was not crowded.

title: Lekki Tourist Market
text:
The Lekki Tourist Market is a must visit. Quality souvenirs at rock bottom price, if you can bargain well.  

It is located very close to the Elegushi Beach and tucked Off Oba Saheed Ademola Elegushi Road, Beach Market Road, Jakande Estate, Lekki-Epe Expressway, Lagos.

title: For Jewelry & Art Lovers
text:
I went to the market with N5,000 as my spend budget on accessories. My discovery was slowed down by the crazy heat (Sun), It was really crazy but I eventually got cool accessories.

These are the kind of things I found when I went to ghana. The market was filled with a lot of handmade accessories from beads, to fresh water pearls, leather skins, it was almost unbelievable. 

I said to my friend that Nigerians are so super creative with the artifacts in the market. 

The market is not your typical market but more modern like you will find in other countries, if you understand art and are looking for different unique craft items this is the market to go. 

They make a lot of the art and crafts there e.g butterfly skin paintings (I probably touched more animals in the market than I have ever done in my life). So, they use animal skins for some of the deco’s (Butterfly, Zebra, snake and more). 

I barely spent the 5,000 from the market but I only got 2 items for N2,500 (A vintage purse I adore for N1,900 and N600 for the necklace).

For accessories the market is really affordable. Advice for local's is don't be deceived by the prices they tell you, still go hard on negotiating and the sellers don't like that.

title: Un mercato caratteristico
text: Al Lekki market potete trovare veramente di tutto. Manufatti tipici dell'arte africana e, se sapete come muovervi potreste anche trovare pezzi "unici" e meno turistici. Non semplicissimo da trovare.

title: Excekente
text: Para llevar recuerdos de este país es muy buen mercado,  los precios son buenos y los vendedores no presionan y esta limpio

title: Lekki, a bazzar
text:
You can find anything you want. 
All the prices can be negociated as long as you do not insult the vendors.

A good practice is to buy in bulk and ask for a discount then fake that you are leaving (works everytime) and wait.

title: Great shop for gifts

title: The ONLY place to buy genuine Cabo Verde crafts & souvenirs
text:

She told you the background of any of the items for sale, where they came from and how they were made. The shop also has a partnership with the island prison whereby inmates take craft classes and the goods are sold here.

No sales pressure whatsoever. Relaxed and friendly. 

Reasonably priced and genuine locally produced goods. Visit here safe in the knowledge that your money is kept local.

placeInfo.name: Djunta Mo Art
placeInfo.address: Rua 1 de Junho Predio Plaza, Santa Maria, Ilha do Sal 4111 Cape Verde

title: Djunta Mo Art
text: Following recommendations I visited both Djunta mo Art shops in Santa Maria. The shop assistants were lovely and did not pressurise you to make a purchase. I love the fact that their items are made on the islands of CV by a cooperative and profits are ploughed back into the cooperative. I appreciate that all souvenier shops and stalls have to make a living but a lot of their products are imported from the likes of China so therefore not authentic to CV. Go and take a look, their products are not expensive.

title: Elmina Tours Free Walking Tours
text:
We discovered Origins Hidden History free walking tours on their website; elminatours.com. We met our guide at Fort Jago at 10am, we were 9 people on the tour. We wanted to explore Elmina Town and meet with the locals, this tour gave us the chance.
We had lots of questions and the guide answered all of them, he was well versed in local history and did a fantastic job. The tour was free but we tipped him $40 for the two of us. They also run a African Traditional Beliefs tour which we will definitely do next time. Highly recommended for detailed information and shocking facts.

title: Ein absolutes Muss bei einem Ghana-Besuch
text: Ein Besuch des Elmina Castle die über Jahrzehnte in erster Linie als Sklavenburg gedient hat ist wohl eine der interessantesten Sehenswürdigkeiten an der Küste. Ich habe die Führung schon zwei mal gemacht und es war immer sehr interessant.

title: Moving teacheable experience
text: Elmina castle was constructed by the Portuguese who wished to pursue their interests in gold and the promulgation of their faith. Somehow (!!!) they ended up trading in human flesh as part of The transatlantic slave trade. There are old artefacts that remain at the castle and a visit is a must for anyone who wants to get a better understanding of the trade and the African diaspora. I travelled with a party of adults and teens to take a tour of the dungeons where human beings were chained oftentimes in close proximity to the slavers’ places of worship. It’s a moving, educational experience. But, and this is a drawback that MUST be fixed, our guide did not speak clearly. He was muffled or too softly spoken, too fast and wouldn’t stop to make sure we’d understood. One member of my party heard nothing but a few dates rattled out so quickly they made no sense to him. What a missed opportunity!! Elmina Castle, please fix this!! Everyone else: please visit.

title: Overshadows Cape Coast Castle
text: The value added to our visit to this paramount attraction was the excellent orientation and commentary by guide and author Ato Ashun. If you can only see one castle on the coast, be sure that it is this one. BTW, the Coconut Grove Bridge House café across the bridge is perfect for lunch.

title: An educational trip - A reality check-up
text:
This tour of Elmina Castle was a reality check for me.  It brought home the horrors of human history.  The tour guide was excellent.  I will recommend.

The only tip is to be careful of the boys outside the castle trying to sell some shells trying to swindle money out of visitors by getting you to sponsor non-existent local football teams.

title: A meeting with the dark part of our common history - and a pledge for acting today!
text:
This castle was built in the 1480s by the Portuguese and soon became an important hub for the Trans-Atlantic slave trade, continuing well into the 19th century under the command of different European powers. The stories told are shocking and humbling - and should hopefully serve to make us better embrace the value of universal human rights and react against today's modern forms of slavery. 

While the international context and drivers behind the slave trade are aspects relatively well covered by the guides, attention should also be given to the local circumstances under which the trade prospered - that is, also reflecting the local rulers' role in the slave trade. This is not a pledge to be "fair" in describing this horrible history - but rather to leave "political correctness" and focus on the factual power relations instead. Only then may this horrendous chapter learn us something.

title: Excellent Tour Guide Explaining The history About The Castle & Area
text: Being out on my full day tour on Monday 20/11/17 with my driver Ben & friend Radak we arrived at Elmina Castle early afternoon & admission fee 40.00 Cedi. Joined a small group of tourists & the young male tour guide was very informative explaining about the history of the Castle going back a few hundred years, shown around different parts of the Castle & reflecting on the terrible past of the prisoners. The guided tour last approximately one hour & you were then free to look around at your own pace taking many beautiful pics especially along the coastline & the historical architectural structure, a very interesting insight about the past & continuous restoration work on-going to maintain the structure for the next generation. A couple of Souvenir shops to browse around with an excellent selection choice of Ghanian postcards & gifts. I highly recommend a visit to the Castle while visiting Ghana.

title: Interresant og lærerikt
text: Guidet tur rundt på slottet. Vi fulgte slavenes vei gjennom fangehull og ut til stedet de ble satt i båter og lastet på skip for ferden over havet. Kunnskapsrik guide og flott slott!

title: An amazing place. Rich in history.
text: What an amazing place. It is really well preserved and the guides share with you not only the history, but what this building means for the people of Africa. Well worth a visit!

title: A piece of special architecture, an area of sadness and well kept piese of a castle.
text:
.Elmina’!!..Not a lot going on but an interesting fishing community with lot of history.
 i have been to all the castle and fort around the coaster part of Ghana and the story seems to be the same,.."The Black man has always worked hard!..the boarders are closed to them even to their colonial masters who benefited massively from them, it sad!..even today the black man still fight on to get basic needs but one-day very soon, we will all understand that blood is red in every animal created..i am too emotional now...sorry.
.before i talk about something, let me just thank the organization for keeping the place well,..Very well preserved castle. The tour guides give an excellent potted history of the castle and its role in the slave trade..
we need love, everyone needs love an acceptance....

title: Molto interessante
text: Molto interessante, vale sicuramente la pena visiterlo, compreso il Fish market di Elmina a pochi passi da lì

title: An imposing structure
text: A substantial castle set immediately on the coast in Elmina village dominating the coastline no doubt adding to the impression of power to those it enslaved. 40GHc entrance fee for foreigners which is just about reasonable given that you have a large structure to explore. You can have a guide and have the history explained to you but that is easy to find or already well known otherwise why are you here? Suffice to say that this predates the more frequently visited Cape Coast castle by around 150 years but shares the common theme of its primary use. Well worth a visit in a easy photographic location. There are the usual scams tried outside where they'll ask your name so it will be on a bracelet when you come out and try to make you feel guilty to buy it or 'sponsor their school'. Just firmly and politely say no and they are not troublesome.

title: Uma experiência marcante
text: Nenhuma pessoa fica imune à experiência de visitar um lugar que lembra o sofrimento de um povo e a marca vergonhosa da escravidão!

title: A piece of European architecture that came to symbolise man's inhumanity to man.
text: Elmina started life as a coastal store house for the early 15th century Portuguese traders in West Africa. It was so  named because of the nearby inland mines. Once the Portuguese traders, in return for their goods, started to accept captured slaves as a form of currency from local warrior chieftains, the store rooms of Elmina  began to be used for holding slaves.  Elmina is small compared to some of the other coastal slave forts but still exudes an immense feeling of pathos as the visitor passes through the same hellish rooms in which hundreds of men, women and children were incarcerated for before their trans-Atlantic crossing. The castle possesses an original "door of no return" through which the slaves would have to pass through onto the boats.

title: Heart rending
text: This is a well kept castle steeped in rather disgraceful behaviour by The Dutch and Portuguese in particular. Different times but how could religious people commit such heinous crimes against humanity. The Gate of No Return is an emotional expetisne. Just gaze  out to sea and think how you would feel leaving everything behind, not knowing what to expect especially after weeks in the inhumane and fetid conditions.

title: Fantastic....Must have a guide
text: We went to the Elmina Castle with a tour group run by Transafrica, a tour group specializing in tours in West Africa. The experience was very educational, moving, and emotional. To see one of the many doors of no return and to learn how the slaves were treated below the church service, was depressing. However, it's an important part of history and the guide's words at the end were thoughtful when he encouraged all of us who had been angered by the inhumane treatment of those who passed through the fort's gates, to not become the thing we hate. So in that way, I think this is a must do.

title: Spannend
text: Ein weiteres der sehr interessanten Sklaven-Forts an der ghanaischen Küste. Eine Führung vermittelt fesselnde Einblicke in die düstere Zeit des Sklavenhandels und die schlimme Rolle der Europäer dabei. Sehenswert!

title: Emotional but worth going
text: We had a wonderful tour guide Korfi, I must say it was not easy when they tell you the happenings of that place, in some places I felt claustrophobic because when you use your imagination to try experience what it was like. As an African you go through the strangest emotions as you go through the castle I felt shock, anger, betrayal and helplessness at some point I felt like crying. It also felt like some of the slaves are still there. Do not get me wrong that was my personal experience and it was worth it for me.

title: et must når man er i Ghana
text: Imponerende fort med skræmmende historie. Inkluderet i entre er en guidet rundvisning. Guiden var generelt godt vidende, men lidt uinspirerende i attitude. Vær opmærksom på at rundvisningen ender med at du bliver ledt ud af en udgang, og derfor ikke kan vende tilbage for at tage fotos eller selv gå rundt, med mindre du aftaler det med guiden

title: Eindrucksvolle Sklavenhändlerfestung
text: Informative Führung, ausführliche Erklärungen, Antworten auf Fragen. Mindestens eine Sklavenhändlerfestung sollte jeder Ghana-Reisende besichtigt haben.

title: Intéressant
text:
Le bâtiment en lui même n'était pas le plus beau jamais vu,  mais le guide a su nous faire vivre l'histoire du lieu,  et a transformé le visite en moment génial. 
Très intéressant pour comprendre le pays

title: Main Vudu center and historic place
text: A must see if you are in Benin: center of the Vudu world wide, king still living there with family and ministers, absolutely nice local art to get directly from artisans!!

title: Pour le coup il y a des dizaines de palais !!!
text:
Pas extraordianaire, a voir pour la culture du pays mais ca ne vaut pas le voyage.
En plus c'est pas super mis en valeur, ni super entretenu.

title: interessanter Ort
text: Die königlichen Paläste sind weitgehend einstöckig, rituelle Rundgebäude sogar eher unterirdisch und nicht so spektakulär, weil sie sich über eine riesige Fläche erstrecken. Die mit Wellblechdach beschützen Gebäude wirken sehr wenig original, sondern stark nachträglich rekonstruiert. Innen die Museumsräume bergen einige wahrhaft sehenswerten Schätze, von außen sehen sie weniger spektakulär aus.

title: Could do with some improvements!
text: Went to the places and museum. Signage is awful (and all in French which would be fine if it was readable), so it is hard to know what it being conveyed. The museum was good, however no English guides and again all the signage was in French. All 6 of our group were English speaking as well as 2 lots of other visiting groups. Perhaps this could be an improvement. The artefacts were interesting, and the museum itself was interesting just a shame it got lost in translation along the way!

title: Mauern und sonst nichts
text:
Wie beim Palace nichts interessantes zu entdecken. Man schaut sich eine große überwucherte Fläche, mit ein paar Mauern drumherum an. Der Rest ist für Touristen gespeert.
In der Nähe ist ein Vodoo-Markt den man noch besuchen kann.

title: Mauerreste und rostiges Blech
text: Außer ein paar Lehmbauten mit verrosteten Blechdächern und div. Mauerresten gibt es nicht viel zu sehen. Einzig um einen Eindruck über den Sklavenhandel zu erhalten geignet. Am Besten man besucht das Museum und schaut sich die Königsschätze an.

title: And this is a UNESCO World Heritage Centre
text:
The signage is awful or non existent, the locations spread across the town and no map available so you absolutely must have a guide to make sense of the place. We found a good guide at the Tourist Office, we paid about €30 for 2 of us for about 4 hours including the use of motorcycle taxis to travel between the various locations. The guide was knowledgeable and helped make sense of the restored monuments. There is essentially nothing original, the walls and buildings were rebuilt around 2007 and since then nothing has been done. The buildings are decaying, the signs are rusting and becoming illegible. 
The museum is worth visiting separately, it gives some more information on the Abomey Kingdom. Entry is 3 euro. Our guide was OK but more interested in completing the tour than imparting understanding of the Kindgoms.
One day is enough for Abomey.

title: Malheureusement très mal maintenues
text: Les guides essayent de leurs mieux de rendre l'experience excellente. Pourtant les structures ne le permettent presque pas. Quel dommage!

title: Why...
text: This is a Unesco world heritage and really poorly maintained. Despite that the guides are really striving at making it a superb experience. The palaces are barely recognizable - really a pitty. Sorry to be so frank about it.

title: storia
text:
Il Benin è un paese bellissimo, dove le persone sono pacifiche e gentili. 
Ti senti subito a tuo agio. La strada per questo sito ci è stata indicata da un signore incontrato nell'ufficio postale.
La guida ti spiega tutto alla perfezione, ma non vuole essere fotografato.
Entri nella storia di questo paese prima che arrivassero i conqustatori a tentare di rovinare tutto.

title: Musée correcte
text:
Musée sans prétention,

Palais royal qui se laisse visité. Un petit aperçu de l'histoire du Bénin.

Pour les curieux.

title: If you are in this part of the world worth seeing
text: Very interesting guided tours puts a whole new perspective of African tribal life/cultures and history.  Guides are (almost) mandatory! but it was well worth it.

title: un fascino antico
text:
i palazzi restaurati e la gentilezza e disponibilità della guida
peccato che molti palazzi siano stati distrutti

title: Histoire et culture
text: Le palais royal d'Abomey vaut franchement le coup d'être visité pour son côté historique et culturel. Si vous avez la chance de tomber sur un guide qui connait bien l'histoire du royaume du Dahomey, vous vous régalerez.

title: Interessant
text:
Visite intéressante pour comprendre l'histoire du royaume du Dahomey. Les guides vous permettront de mieux aborder la culture Béninoise que ce soit  à travers tous les rois et leur histoire mais aussi sur certains aspect du vaudoun.
Les filles apprécieront les vendeurs de bijoux à la sortie du musée

title: Royal palaces
text: Really interesting to visit. The palaces have many features realting to the Ancient Voodoo Culture and also the warring Kingdoms of Dahomey. The buildings are partially preseved and extensive as each generation established their own palace.

title: Belle visite
text: Petite visite culturelle bien sympa, guide nécéssaire mais un peu trop de détails à notre gout. Bel endroit pour faire une pause.

title: Worth Visiting
text: It's all depend on the individual and your perception about African culture and tradition, about how  kings were venerated and the cruelity by which our forefathers were governed. There is an entrance fee though but pictures are not allowed inside the once palace because things there are sacred.

title: Incontournable, centre historique du Benin
text:
Pour qui veut comprendre l'histoire de ce beau pays, la passage à Abomey est incontournable. Il est rare dans les musées des ex colonie de retrouver une collection d'objet digne de ce nom, ici, par chance beaucoup de trace de l'histoire sont restées (même si le guide fait remarquer avec un sourir en coin que "Chirac nous a volé cet exemplaire pour le mettre au musée d'Orsay").
La visite dure environ 1h30 ce qui est tout a fait compatible du temps de concentration des enfants.

title: The view alone of the ocean makes it worth while!
text:
We arrived there after going to the Kakum National Park and the view towards the ocean is just breath taking!
We had hired a tour guide with a driver, and it took alot of pressure off, we could just enjoy the sights.
The castle is a slave castle with every possible disgusting behavior towards the slaves that you could imagine being done in the 1890’s. Although slavery has been abolished, my perspective is that it just changed names and we call it now : human trafficking. I wish they would touch on that a little, but I guess that would not be too popular with the tourists!
All the same, a beautiful coast line, I don’t regret any moment of this sight!

title: Visit to the Cape Coast Castle
text: Had a wonderful black slavery historic tour experience for the first time at the cape coast castle with Worlanyo Tours. I loved it.

title: Qualcosa di nuovo per un italiano
text: Tra le cose da vedere sicuramente deve esserci il Castello di Cape Coast, una residenza coloniale da cui partivano gli schiavi per l'intera Europa. È toccante vedere le prigioni. È carino perché è comuqneu qualcosa di diverso per chi è abituato ai Castelli Europei. Nulla di eccezionale, ma racconta un po' di storia. C'è anche un piccolo museo all'interno.

title: Echoes from Africa's Tragic Past- The Slave Trade at Cape Coast, Ghana
text: This is a place which provokes in one a mixture of emotions that are difficult to describe. One can actually feel the anguish, fear and humiliation slave men and women must have felt in the dark slave dungeons. The slaves did not know any crime they must have committed to deserve such dehumanisation. Families were ripped apart, family history was lost, centuries old culture was lost and all sense of humanity was sacrificed for filthy lucre.

title: Guide group
text:
We visited here as part of a weekend rest from our project. Yes it was a standard tourist stop but great information in the museum plus a tour guide made our visit very interesting and informative.  Sadly we can’t turn back the clock and remake history but good to acknowledge it and make sure that in future respect for individuals and nations is paramount. 
Great views for photos too.

title: Incredible History
text: Visited with friends. A very intense and emotional tour which should be experienced by everyone. The guide was well prepared.

title: Cape Coast Castle
text: Though a Ghanaian and a guide anytime i get the chance to take people to the castle to learn about the slave trade it reminds me how far the world has come in abolishing such dehumanizing atrocities. The guides at the castle are professional, knowledgeable and great.

title: you will never be the same again.
text: Our tour guide was outstanding. It is very very heavy duty, emotional experience, and one that I will never forget. I am forever changed by this experience.

title: Castillo de esclavos
text: Toda la costa está sembrada de estos castillos, de tiempos coloniales donde el lucrativo negocio de los esclavos estaba en auge.

title: Worth to visit
text: You can read it history book but to see is a wow. Tour includes to entry price, 40ghs. You can visit old cell, torture rooms, market place, also there is museum.

title: piège à touristes
text: De bric et de broc, artisanat sans intérêt, probablement pas capverddien,  ou si peu, et étrangement cher... mais peu de concurrence,  il est vrai.

ownerResponse.text: Cher critique, je ne comprends pas quand vous dites que les arts ne sont probablement pas capverdian et coûteux.  Nous sommes la plus ancienne boutique cadeau 100 % capverdian et nous avons l'un des meilleurs prix en ville. Merci

placeInfo.name: Art D’Cretcheu
placeInfo.address: Ave 5 de Julho Centro Cultural Do Mindelo, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Cerchi un oggetto indigeno particolare? Qui lo trovi.
text: Bel negozietto, in stile coloniale, dove puoi trovare ogni tipo di oggetto (souvenir, collezione, eccetera) ad un prezzo molto interessante. Capo Verde in generale non è buon mercato ma qui potrete acquistare gestendo oculatamente il vostro capitale!

placeInfo.name: Art D’Cretcheu
placeInfo.address: Ave 5 de Julho Centro Cultural Do Mindelo, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: I had a really nice time and I am glad I visited
text:
Amazing place to visit 
Saw a lot of stuffs and they all looked really nice 
Took some pictures with the fela portraits 
Wonderful place to recommend

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: Great ambiance
text: The ambiance was so great, Mama Nike was very gracious with our time. She basically walked us through the gallery. The art was amazing and I recommend this for place who’s interested in African culture

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: Lovely artworks
text:
The place is so nice and we couldn’t view all the artworks.
We’ll love to attend this place again and we hope to see more beautiful artworks

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: Amazing
text:
The views were amazing. Had loads of fun and the staffs were helpful.

Learnt a lot about the beauty of art🤭🥰

And I'd love to come here some other time

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: Awesome
text: The arts were so inspiring. I was captivated and it brought tears of nostalgia. Beautiful experience, awesome tour guide, perfect in all

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: A Good Time
text: It was a special experience with a patient guide who took us through the art works, explaining their history and origin. Thank you Nike Art Gallery!

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: Aweeeeesssooommmeee!!💕💕💕💕💕💕💕💕💕💕💕
text: It was an amazing experience with amazing art works. Seeing this wonder art gallery for free in Lagos is really a great thing . It brings out great ideas and shows talented work.

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: My friend and I loved the arts so much. We took a look of pictures, we made videos, we danced, we appreciated artists
text: The views were amazing. We took a lot of pictures and we made videos. The arts were lovely. I really wanted to go home with one of them.

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: A "Must Visit"
text:
A must visit.

I can call this the premier contemporary art gallery in Nigeria. The history, vastness and simplicity of the project is commendable. 

Great job.

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: My views at Nike art gallery
text: I am impressed with all that I saw at the Nike art gallery. This country is great with so many talented artists. God bless the foundation and Nigeria.

placeInfo.name: Nike Centre For Art And Culture
placeInfo.address: No. 2, Elegushi Road 3rd Roundabout, Epe Expressway, Lagos 106104 Nigeria

title: Leuke prullaria
text: Leuke Afrikaanse markt, waarvan kooplui hun waren aanbieden. Het bekende houtsnijwerk us hier in overvloed aanwezig. Verder zijn er volop schilderijen te koop wat eveneens een leuke herinnering is. Tevens zijn er kleermakers die je een op maat gemaakte Afrikaanse snit kunnen aanmeten.

title: Schöne Andenken!
text: Optimal für alle, die sich ein schönes Andenken an Lagos besorgen wollen. An die Märkte von Abuja gewöhnt, fand ich es total entspannend hier ein bisschen zu shoppen, die anfangspreise sind moderater und man wird als "oyibo" nicht so angegangen.

title: Market mainly for souvenirs
text: Its a popular place for tourist and residents to buy souvenirs in much cheaper prices than some "luxury"shops in the town. Its hot,stinky,dusty,etc.place. Please dress very simple,no jewellery on you (that immediately will shout you are a "fresh fish" and the price will jump to sky), don't show you have money, arrange small notes in different pocket,have hat&water,sunblock on you. If you see your piece,prepare to bargain. Usually 3 times less the price they ask. Remember,bargain is a must. Even if the seller is not agree,don't be disappointed,just walk away and believe me,they'll run after you. Better is to go with somebody who knows the place-friend,driver,local or resident with experience ......Thirsday mornings usually is sanitations(cleaning time)for markets,so will not be open till noon. Saturday is full with expats,if this will make you to fill better. People are friendly,if you smile,but I'll not go there alone for sample.

title: A good shopping centre
text:
It was quite a good place to shop for variety of household items including grocery, fresh fruits, utensils, etc.
I was more happy to see wide options of good pearls, corals. I enjoyed shopping here.

title: Lekki Market for Tourists
text:
You find all kind of artifacts and local stuff ranging from clothes, bangles, souvenirs.

The market is a bit unorganised, but you find everything you are looking for to remind you of the different cultures of the Nigerian people

title: A typical market where you can buy everything - not in a good way
text: If you are looking for a bunch of trashy souvenirs to buy this is the place to go. It's also the place to go if you want to bug random animals that are caged up and tortured. Then again it's a typical market where you have lots of sellers and buyers in an ambiguous location. In all honesty, there are some good items to buy here but I would recommend hiring a local to barter for you and take you around. Overall, good fabrics and local crafts, but some of the sellers just left a bad taste in my mouth.

title: Treasure everywhere
text: Love this place. Full of local talent and wonderful pieces. Haggling met with smiles but be prepared to be approached constantly. Fabrics, furniture and art my favourite things here. No toilets. Can be muddy.

title: INDIGENOUS NIGERIAN ARTS & CRAFTS MARKET
text:
Excellent market for buying all sorts of Nigerian Arts, Crafts, Fabrics, Leatherware, Carvings etc,
Be ready to haggle and negotiate like a pro to get good bargains.
The market also has a section for fresh vegetables and fruits.
Relatively safe but like any market you need to keep your money safe and your bag in front of you

title: Absolutely must visit!
text: One of the top places to visit in Lagos.  Full of character and interesting things to see and buy.  From art and antiques to fruit and veg.  The stall holders are friendly and helpful and are willing to barter the prices.  However, just beware of the flock of young boys who greet you as you arrive who want to be the ones to show you around and take you to the best deals, and who expect to be paid (a small amount) for the privilege.

title: Great for local art
text: Hard to find, down a horrible dirt road, hidden behind local market, is a very large artisan market.  It's not well marked, our local driver had to ask several times for where it was located.  When w did arrive I didn't believe it and walked into the area before it changed to art.  It's worth the trip not only do you get some local color, but the art is quite good and many of the stall are populated by the artist.  I saw some of the reviews complain about the hard sell.  Well we didn't experience any of that and I've gone to most artisan markets in the region of West Africa.  This one was quite laid back in comparison.  there are local young adults when you walk in that will try to attach themselves to you. Either ignore, or as we did pick one and if they know what your looking for will take you to specific stalls.  The place is not small so allow yourself some time, and barter you'll be surprised hoe inexpensive things are.  We got some excellent masks and had a good time interacting with the artisans.  Felt very safe.

title: Per respirare un po' di cultura locale
text: Interessante Sao Vicente, i suoi mercatini, i luoghi in cui si parla della cultura locale. Sicuramente da visitare.

title: Bom para conhecer sua cultura
text: o centro cultural de Mindelo, vale a pena conhecer para se saber um pouco da culrura do local. Tem apresentações de teatro  noite.

title: Precisoso e fundamental para entender a historia da cidad e
text:
O Centro Cultural do Mindelo, antiga alfandega, é um edificio belissimo e fundamental conhecer para entender a cidade e a importancia do Porto Grande do Mindelo em toda a historia da cidade. 
Hoje em dia e um centro de exposições com direcção de Tony Tavares e também as suas exposições são, em geral, muito boas.

title: Well worth a Visit
text:
The museum was well set out with local artefacts, and some fabulous fabric work 
....a combination of hand made carpet, collage and embroidery with wool.  Stunning and very clever.
The souvenir shop sold some local paintings ...excellent  .....and some interesting local souvenirs.  We watched some Portuguese based dancing and singing that took place at the museum.  The three man group was great as was the singing, .and the dancing was a combination of jive, and sometimes exceedingly suggestive but with taste!  Each island in the group has its own dance, not necessarily music, so each dance was very different.   Sitting in the courtyard tasting the local grog ...43% proof....it was very pleasant indeed!

title: ambachten, kunst en muziek, eten en drinken
text: In het gratis toegankelijke Centro Cultural zijn ambachten, lokale kunst en andere produkten te zien en te koop. In het weekend zijn er hoogwaardige muziekuitvoeringen met niet alleen de lokale muzieksoorten maar ook gastoptredens, ik heb bijvoorbeeld een groep uit Mali en Senegal gehoord en gezien. De concerten zijn vaak van 19:00 tot 20:30, dus een prima manier om het wachten op het diner te verkorten. Ik ben er iedere dag wel een uurtje geweest, het restaurant is simpel maar lekker en niet duur.

title: versteckte Künstler
text: Eine unscheinbare Tür in einer Bretterwand öffnet den Zugang zum Centro Cultural. Die Künstler fertigen hier ihre Figuren für den Karneval. Das Ganze mutet etwas  chaotisch an. Coole Aufbauten und Sujets.

title: Patrimônio cultural
text: Local reúne exposições de artistas locais, espaço para apresentações teatrais, local para leitura e para fazer um lanche. Localizado no centro da cidade.

title: Worth it for the Carnival display
text: I was not impressed with the building generally, but we were lucky enough to visit it just after a special Carnival exhibition had been set up. This displayed several of the actual costumes worn during carnival, as well as a rolling film of some of the highlights of the 2016 carnival. It is definitely worth visiting for this if the exhibition is still running.

title: Not impressed with the exhibition
text: This is a large building across the road from the seafront. It is quite large with high ceilings which make the whole building cool. There is an exhibition space as you come in with a shop on the right, and a library further back on the left and a theatre/lecture room at the rear behind a central courtyard. Public toilets were very welcome.

title: UNA BONITA CASA DE CULTURA
text: es un precioso lugar, donde ver que varias los actos culturales , hay bastante artesania que puedes comprar , ademas de salas de exposiciones con pintura de cabo verde , merece la pena entrar

title: An overview of a day in Mindelo as a cruise port
text:
We have been to Mindelo twice now, both as a one day port of call whilst on a cruise. We have had a pleasant time on both occasions, though if you are seeking glamour and modern shopping centres this is not the port for you. If however you like to explore every port and seek out what it has to offer, you can certainly enjoy your time here. The scope of the excursions offered from the ship (or rather the lack of) give a good indication of what you might expect here.

It is a short walk along the port road, though a minibus shuttle has been offered each time we have visited.As you walk along the coast road you will see fishermen and as you reach the town, they will be gutting and selling fish on the beach. It is a very laid back place and understand that unemployment is extremely high and so many people 'hanging around'.

Still on the waters edge you will find a small fishing museum 'Museu do Mar' (based on the style of the Belem Tower in Lisbon) which is certainly worth a look and then next along is the fish market, which can be interesting to see what different countries have on offer.  There isn't really anything if you continue on further, but if you now head inland you will find the market square, which has a differing number of stalls depending on the day. You will see many beautiful blue and white art tiles, also as seen in Portugal.

 If you now take the street parallel to the coast road, you will find a rather nice gallery/craft shop and also the church. Onward and then to the right you will find an indoor market (can't quite remember but it may be the old town hall) and also see the beautiful colonial architecture of the pink palace, Palacio do Povo (Peoples palace). The University is located behind this, accessed to the right as you look at the Palace.

Back down to the harbour and you will find the cultural centre - a small affair but easy to walk into, friendly staff, local music playing (CD not live) and some interesting artwork on display (though it does change so may just depend how you catch it). They also sell stamps so you can send your postcards much cheaper than on ship.

Back on the waters edge where the shuttle bus departs is a tourist centre, which offers a very pleasant stop for a beverage! Our first visit was at the weekend and a local performing group entertained us for a hour or so, but our subsequent visit was a weekday and this did not occur. We enjoyed a very pleasant lunch. The wind breaks were much appreciated on the breezy and cool January day, which was quite a contrast from the blazing hot sun we experienced thee previous time in April.
Some fellow passengers felt ill at ease here and if looking at the photographs this may apply to you, perhaps consider booking one of the ships excursions so that at least you see a little of the island.

title: Bom
text: È bom conhecer muitas vezes tem esposicao de arte nao so o batimento è estilo antigo lindicimo tem atracao de teatro a noite

title: Always changing
text: This is a very central building and easy to walk into and there was no admission fee.  The first time we went by there was nothing really going on, but with a lot of activity of changing paintings and art work.  Several visits later there was a band playing inside and then a choir.  The craft/souvenir store has some same same items but also offers unique one of a kind (or at least we did not see duplicates at other stores) trinkets.  Worth while to check this building out as you pass by each time.

title: Great spot for local crafts
text: The center is located in an interesting old building across from the waterfront and houses an excellent little shop with local handicrafts. On this barren windswept island, recycling reigns and you'll find wallets made from colorful local coffee bags, bracelets made from aluminum can pull-tabs and jewelry crafted from K-cup coffee containers. And it's all really attractive! You can also purchase local coffee and rum, along with CDs of famed singer Cesaria Evora, a native daughter.

title: музей ремесел
text: если интересно узнать, чем занимались люди на острове, кроме рыбалки - зайдите в музей на центральной площади города и походите по прохладным залам,любуясь на незатейливые произведения ткачей, гончаров и других ремесленников. Цена билета смешная, а впечатление очень милое. Дополните его поездкой на целый день на соседний остров Санту Антау на персональном джипе за 80$ на всех и вы будете иметь полное впечатление о жизни островитян. Обязательно попробуйте сахарный тростник, купите бутылочку сахарного сиропа - альтернатива кленовому- вкусный сувенир в дополнение к магнитику с ракушками, для мужчин больше подойдет национальный продукт перегонки - ром. а после всех экскурсий полюбуйтесь на пляже местными девушками с фигурами статуэток, виндсерферами и тинейджерами, выполняющими акробатические трюки прямо на песке.

title: Preciosidade arquitectural
text: Situado bem no Centro da cidade do Mindelo, a uma distância de cerca de 15 metros do mar, com uma excelente vista para a Baía do Mindelo, uma das mais belas do Mundo, segundo uma classificação da Unesco, o CCM (Centro Cultural do Mindelo), é uma preciosidade arquitectural, estilo colonial, onde funcionou a antiga Alfândega do Governo colonial Português. É um espaço cultural multifunções com uma interacção formidável com a Cidade e sua população.

title: Un bel mercato etnico africano.
text:
Nel centro città di Mindelo troverete un mercato all'aperto che, oltre ad ospitare numerosissimi venditori senegalesi raccoglie nelle sue "casette / negozio" molte altre etnie africane. Potrete trovare coloratissimi foulard provenienti dal Benin, oppure statue in legno Togolesi, o ancora dei magnifici "Boubou" del Ghana, eccetera eccetera. 
I prezzi non sono sempre buoni ma, come un po' dappertutto in Africa, tutto va discusso. Alla fine vedrete che acquirente e venditore si accordano quasi sempre.

title: Upscale shop with interesting and varied designs
text: Fabulous selection. Friendly, helpfull staff! My brother bought a handmade painting for his girlfriend. She loved it!

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Local art and artisan craftwork
text: One of the few places in Cabo Verde where you can buy local art and artisan craftwork. They offer a wide range of products - local food and drinks, textiles, products made of recycled materials, paintings from local artists, etc. We highly recommend it.

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Emerveillées par la qualité des objets présentés
text: le magasin propose de multiples objets de grande qualité qui sont magnifiques, réalisés par les artisans du Cap vert. le personnel est très attentifs et disponible, notre visite terminait notre séjour au Cap Vert et nous avons été enchantées par notre visite et avons ramené de très jolis souvenirs. lieu à conseiller impérativement

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Well worth a visit.
text: Friendly & helpful staff. One assistant went out of her way to actually guide us to another shop we needed to visit. Wide range of artisan products at reasonable prices. I bought a hand carved and decorated pestle & mortar. A delightful reminder of our visit to Mindelo. Well worth a visit.

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Local artisan crafts
text: Fantastic range of Cape Verde crafts from small to large. Helpful staff. Buy your books, cards, materials & home designs here.

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Bestes Deko Geschäft in Mindelo
text:
Sehr gute Qualität, es werden nur Sachen verkauft die auch auf den Inseln hergestellt werden!
Man kann sogar einen Transport nach Europa organisieren!
Ganz wichtig man wird nicht gezwungen etwas zu kaufen!
Der Musikstand könnte grösser sein.
Wärmstens zu empfehlen!

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Lovely gallery and shop
text:
This gallery has a wide selection of beautiful artisanal items and art; 
from pottery to rugs, furniture, accessories, jewels, music, and photography.

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: recherche artisanat local pour ramener des souvenirs
text: belle decouverte, un tres bon acceuil et des produits artisanaux  vraiment cap verdiens fabriques par des locaux .

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Artisanat de qualité
text: Une belle boutique qui présente de beaux objets et produits cap-verdiens. Ça va de la babiole, carte postale, à de beaux tissages, objets de déco, petits meubles, quelques livres aussi, chose rare ! Avec un personnel sympathique.

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: The only place to find all Cabo Verde craftswork
text:
This beautiful store has it all: style, choice, atmosphere, service, and all the craftswork from the country. Most objects are found nowhere else than here as the French owner did her homework and searched for the artisans in the different islands. 
Everything you can think of is here, weither you are looking for magnets, fabrics, objects made with different leaves (cane...), books, music, lamps and lampshades, jewels, ceramics, food, soaps, alcohol... I bought all my gifts for my friends in this store as, on top of it, the staff is very useful, nice and knowledgeable. Definitely the place to come to in Mindelo for all your gifts!

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: pequeno Cabo Verde em forma de Design
text: Para mim a melhor loja de lembranças no Mindelo para não dizer cabo verde . Muito bom gosto em todas as peças .

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Beau magasin
text: La boutique est jolie, spacieuse et présente de beaux objets d'artisanat capverdien (bijoux, objets de décoration, tissus...) de belle qualité. Certes, les prix sont un peu plus chers qu'ailleurs mais on est sûr que ça ne vient pas de Chine ou du Sénégal...

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Produits choisis bien présentés
text:
"l'artisanat n'est pas le point fort du cap vert" m'avait on dit.
En faisant un tour dans ce magasin on s'aperçoit vite qu'il n'en est rien, beaucoup de choses choisies avec un goût certain et de fort belle facture ( le prix va évidemment de paire).
Un bien bel endroit à découvrir, filtré par un goût un peu occidental mais on en redemande.

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Interessant shopping
text:
Au moins ici on est surs que les produits sont locaux et non pas africains. Je prefere payer plus cher ces articles et favoriser l artisanat des villages des iles du cap vert que d acheter des babioles made in china..
Personnel tres sympa

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: BUSINESS IS BUSINESS
text:
Revente sans âme de superbes produits et créations artisanales locales. Leurs articles sont revendus 4 fois plus cher du prix bradé par l'artisan. On est très loin d'un commerce équitable, parcontre leurs articles sont d'authentiques productions artisanales.
Personnel sans âmes, boutique de luxe, prix très élevés, pour exemple vous pourrez acheter un authentique Pilon à un local entre 1500 et 2000 escudos max, quand vous en payerez entre 8000 et 12000 escudos chez cap vert disgn.

ownerResponse.text:
Bien dommage que ce message soit anonyme... Les pilons anciens ne sont pas destinés aux Capverdiens. Quant aux touristes, ils ont beaucoup de difficultés à les emporter dans leurs sacs à dos ou dans leurs bagages limités à 20 kg. En fait, ils témoignent d’une tradition capverdienne d’origine africaine et leur prix est dissuasif. Il en va de même pour les moulins de pierre et les pots anciens en terre cuite. Nous ne tenons pas à vider le Cap-Vert de ses richesses, ni à le brader ! 
À noter en Europe, les pilons sont vendus 280 Euros (28.000 Escudos).

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Amazing shop
text: Fantastic shop for tourists. Helpful and nice staff. Amazingly crafted pieces! Well worth a visit👍🏼

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Rapport qualité prix déplorable
text:
La boutique est belle, il y a beaucoup de choix, mais les prix sont parfaitement indécents pour le Cap-Vert. 

Allez plutôt faire vos achats sur les marchés pour aider les commerçantes qui se lèvent à l'aube, plutôt qu'engraisser cette boutique attrape touristes

ownerResponse.text:
Madame,
Sachez qu'offrir 450m2 de showroom dédiés exclusivement à l’artisanat de toutes les îles du Cap-vert ne peut être comparé à des vendeurs de rue sans lieu ni charge… Que vous nous décriviez comme "attrape touristes" est insupportable au regard de notre démarche désintéressée, 100% équitable, et du nombre de familles que nous faisons vivre depuis plus de cinq ans.
Bonne route !

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Personale poco gentile
text: Negozio veramente bello, si può trovare veramente tantissime idee da regalo, però purtroppo il personale è veramente poco gentile, l'accoglienza è veramente pessima, il titolare dovrebbe fare un corso hai dipendenti di come dovrebbero  accogliere e trattare i clienti!!

ownerResponse.text: Questa è la prima opinione di questo tipo ! Mi dispiace, ma se hai ragione, è eccezionale. Sinceramente

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: Made In Cabo Verde
text:
I love to shop artisan stores and this was the only one in town.  Lots of local made items of find quality with reasonable prices.  It's unique and a must have and must visit !!!
Upstairs are products for the home but it's worth looking at the unique lampshades etc. Notice the vases on the steps. Sorry, no elevator.

Remember this store is closed during lunch hours.

Also, try to find the Alternativa Galeria on Av. 5 de Julho, M(+238) 994-88-92

It's behind the famous PINK building at the circle and it's the YELLOW building. 
Lunch is available, at reasonable prices and among the great local art.

I love to support and shop at Artesian stores and this maybe the store for you.

Enjoy your stay in Mindelo, Cabo Verde

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato
placeInfo.address: 10/12 Rua da Luz Centre Historique, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 1054 Cape Verde

title: bof l'artisanat local

artisanat plutot faible , rien d'interessant

placeInfo.name: Capvertdesign+Artesanato

title: Molto carina!
text: Merita la visita. Costo ingresso 6 euro, vale la pena spenderli. Bel panorama e suggestivo. Per arrivare a Belém prendere il bus 15 da piazza figeira

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: LO MEJOR LAS VISTAS DESDE LO ALTO
text:
Lo mejor que tiene este monumento son las vistas desde su parte alta. La entrada te cuesta 200 escudos (2€) y dentro de la torre esta el Museo del Mar. Lo mas interesante es lo que cuentan de la historia de cuando Mindelo era puerto ballenero. Mucha foto y huesos de ballena.
Desde luego nada que ver con la Torre de Belem de Lisboa.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Joli musée
text: Nous avons découvert ce musée qui est très complet dans l’histoire de la pêche. L’histoire de Mindelo est très intéressante

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Faz lembrar
text:
È bom ver uma relação com Portugal.
Acaba por ser um tributo simples, mas de visita obrigatória.
As pessoas fazem do lugar um sítio especial.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem

text: Monumento bonito, semelhante À torre de Belém de Lisboa. Junto ao Mercado do peixe, numa das principais artérias do Mindelo.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

text: Inspirée de la célèbre tour de Lisbonne ,ancienne capitainerie,elle offre une jolie vue sur la rade et la ville..mais fermée le dimanche !comme les 3/4 de la ville..

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Petite visite mais environnement animé
text: La  jolie vue sur la ville, la proximité du marché aux poissons et de la rue la plus animée de la ville agrémentent la visite de la réplique de la Tour de Belem de Lisbonne.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

text: la construction rénovée récemment ne présente pas d’intérêt et les "collections" présentées n'apportent aucune connaissance, seul la vue sur la ville vaut la montée

text: Several floors (you need to be fit!) displaying an interesting mix of artefacts showing some of the history of Cape Verde.

Pas d'intérêt particulier sauf la vue sur la ville.
Quelques pièces de musée, en particulier concernant la chasse à la baleine.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem

prachtig uitzicht op de stad

text: Par un jour brumeux ou fatigué d'une rando on peux monter faire une petite visite à ce musée marin en vitesse et aller au marché aux poissons le matin de bonne heure .

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

text:
2€/personne pour la vue sur la ville et le port, c’est tout ce que ça vaut. Le reste est assez minable, du saxo à l’affiche pour un autre musée.
Même pas s’il pleut, vous n’auriez pas la vue.
Pour moins cher, une boisson dégustée tranquillement....

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Só vista
text: Imitação da Torre de Belém portuguesa com um museu do mar no interior. Do cimo deste edifício pode-se observar uma bonita vista sobre a cidade de Mindelo.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: musée de la mer à Mindelo
text:
au coeur de Mindelo, a coté du marché aux poissons  se trouve le musée de la mer.
Quelques panneaux explicatifs sont en Français mais pas suffisamment à mon gout .
Ainsi la visite est rapide .

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Replica
text:
Replica van de echte toren in Lissabon.
Entree 2 euro en aan de balie geven ze je geen ticket, wat ze wel hebben. Of t erg is, is de vraag. Leuk om te bezoeken voor t uitzicht boven op de toren. Ook nog wat informatie over de walvisvangst en wat vissen op sterk water. In 15 minuten heb je het wel gezien. Maar het is een van de weinige bezienswaardigheden in Mindelo dus je gaat er heen.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Great little museum on a small island
text: Prominent building on the waterfront you can't miss Torre de Belem.  For a small island I thought this museum was very interesting. Focussing on whaling I found it informative and well presented. There's a small entrance fee and from the top floor there are lovely views of the town.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: Niet bijzonder
text: De toren zelf als kopie van het origineel in Portugal is niet bijzonder. De omgeving echter wel. De promenade langs de oceaan natuurlijk, maar ook het straatje er recht tegenover dat uitkomt op het grote plein met de marktkraampjes van de lokale bevolking met groente, vis en snuisterijen.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: belle vue sur la ville depuis la terrasse
text: Pour une somme modique, possibilité de visiter le mini musée et de profiter de la vue à 360° sur la ville depuis la tour.

placeInfo.name: Torre de Belem
placeInfo.address: Avenida de Republica, Mindelo, Sao Vicente 2110 Cape Verde

title: A must  go
text: see how a  society lived  and worshipped  just  a  bit over a  century  ago. Grandchildren  who  rememebred  gradndparents who  knew these rulers -  marvel  of  fetishes,  gods   ,  ancestor  worship  and  abject  cruelty  to enemies

title: A  Go See if  in Benin
text: If in the area  one must  go visit this   famous  palace.  Read up on this,  ( I arranged  to  go with an anthropoligst  who  explained    quite  a  bit  about a  society  that  was around  relatively  recently. See the  mediation room  built  with blood  of  41  slaves. It  would be great if  it vwas  maintained   decently and explained  in much  more  detail.There wasnta  soul  there when I visited, went  away marveling .

title: Must visit
text: We visited the Royal Palaces of Abomey as part of a study abroad program in college.  I believe you experience more if you are with a professor or guide as we were.  Very interesting history and cultural experience.  The red sand was amazing.

title: Throne atop Skulls
text: All reviews here are very good. Its a few hours drive up from the coast. A MUST SEE if you are in country.  The Palace has one very unique item.  The Throne. it sits on each leg upon 4 human skulls.  Also visit voodoo Dr. In town.

title: Royal palace and historical atrocitoes
text:
Worthwhile to visit. Do hire a personalia guide. Interesting items referring to voodoo. Benin is the birthplace of voodoo.
The palace had many symbols from formeren Kings. After the death of the old one, a new king extended the palace.
Every king had many wives. After his death, 10-15 wives wereld selected, drugged and forever locked up in a death chamber....

title: Terrific, evocative tour!
text: Great tour of the palaces of two of the kings of the former Kingdom of Dahomey. Lots of artifacts (some original, some copies of originals housed in the Musee de quai Branly in Paris) to help created a sense of life and society during the 300 year expanse of the Kingdom. A must-see if you are touring Benin!

title: Interessante para conhecer a historia do Benin
text: Fizemos a visita com uma guia do museu, que nos deu varias informações interessantes sobre a historia do reino do Dahome e dos reis aos quais os palácios pertenciam. Infelizmente o museu não foi organizado pra visitas sem guia, as explicações escritas não são muito completas.

title: old memory
text: it's all my personal opinion. this old palace that reminds you of a past splendour now it's only an empty space with nothing to show. not worth a visit

title: nothing special
text: it's all my personal opinion but this oldpalace that reminds you of a past splendour now it's only an empty space with nothing to show. not worth a visit

title: Great palace.. but is it worth the trip?
text: Dahomey empire has very interesting characteristics and history, which even made someone who doesn't like museums like me to pay attention to its artefacts and surroundings. But the fact that you're not allowed to take pictures inside is little bit too harsh, and since this is about only attraction you will see in Abomey, and considering it takes such long time to get to Abomey from usual big cities down south, I don't know if it's worth the trip. If you're inevitably passing by the region, or if you're really interested in histories, then sure it's good to go. But I wouldn't say it's a must visit site if you have limited time in Benin. The town itself is interesting in many ways, it's just not that photogenic except for the old symbols on the palaces of Dahomey.

title: Pas d'un grand intérêt et accueil détestable
text:
Nous avons visité le palais royal d'Abomey en janvier 2014. Bon d'abord il faut savoir, mais on s'en doutait, que ces batiment n'ont de "palais royaux" que le nom. Vous n'y verrez que des batiment de terre, quelques "tombes royales" et quelques objets de la vie quotidienne que vous aurez déjà vus dans d'autres musées, voir encore mieux dans les villages locaux.

L'accueil dans ce lieu a été en ce qui nous concerne vraiment détestable : il nous a fallu attendre un bout de temps que quelqu'un vienne, qui n'avait visiblement pas envie de faire de visite. Ma visite a été expédiée en quelques 30 minutes (remarquez plus, pourquoi faire ?) et à noter pour nos amis photographes : il est rigoureusement interdit de prendre des photos à l'intérieur comme à l'extérieur !!! Pour des raisons de respect bien entendu sachant que des cartes postales sont en vente à la sortie....

Bref, visite sans grand intérêt, pas très agréable. Il y a beaucoup d'autres endroits à voir au Bénin, bien plus agréables. C'est en ce qui nous concerne le seul endroit où nous n'avons pas eu le sentiment d'être bienvenus dans ce magnifique pays qu'est le Bénin. passez votre chemin !

title: Visita senza foto
text:
Il sito è patrimonio dell'umanità e non capisco perché non si possano fotografare neppure gli esterni degli edifici. Per il resto un ampio palazzo ricco di storia. La guida illustra in francese la storia e i singoli reperti, secondo me messi un po' a caso, in stanze buie illuminate solo dalla luce delle finestre.
Vale comunque una visita

title: Great grounds, excellent tour
text: Great grounds and museum! Guide w/very good English.  Easy to imagine life as it must have been.  Not many artifacts left; mostly copies of originals now elsewhere.

title: Étape incoutournable d'un voyage au Bénin !
text: L'histoire du Sud du Bénin tourne autour du roi Béhanzin, héros national qui a tenu tête aux colons français. Abomey est le siège de la lignée de ce roi glorieux et de tous ses prédécesseurs. L'ensemble des palais royaux d'Abomey et son musée, sont inscrits au patrimoine mondial de l'Unesco depuis 1985. Plusieurs palais dans un même ensemble permettent de connaître les coutumes des sujets du royaume du Dahomey, de découvrir de nombreuses salles, cours et tombeaux, avec des collections de trônes royaux et de récades (sceptres royaux) en bois sculpté. La visite sous la conduite d'un guide -indispensable- est vraiment passionnante pour comprendre l'histoire longue du pays avant qu'il ne devienne à la fin du XIXème siècle une colonie française. Autour du palais une cité des artisans présente également un grand intérêt avec en particulier des tisserands.

title: Interesting History to Learn
text: The palaces (and other historical sites and museums) were a fascinating insight into the history of the area and of the slave trade.  And if you visit enough different sites around the country, you start piecing things together and understanding better at each stop.

title: Palais à la mode béninoise
text: Plongez-vous dans l'histoire du royaume d'Abomey. Les bâtiments sont de construction traditionnelle : salles de réception, tombeaux, lieux de culte, les collections sont intéressantes, mais ne vous attendez pas à un palais des mille et une nuits. Village artisanal avec des tissus et objets intéressants.

title: kinda interesting...
text:
We are not too much into museums and historical stuff but with Benin having not too many "proper" sightseeings we visited the palaces.
you need a bit of the imagination to get the right impression of the scale of the things that used to happen over there because the only thing you really is a bunch of clay huts - and that is mostly is. the rest your imagination should work out - then why not to watch National Geographic? :)

title: Site historique
text: Très bien documenté ; visite guidée passionnante. Belle collection d'objets, certains étant hélas au Musée du Quai Branly de Paris.

title: Not worth the road trip to get there
text:
The palace tour takes about an hour and is quite interesting. The history of the kings from past to present is included and the exhibits are good and fully show the cruel history of slavery and human sacrifice.   The sight is a Unesco Heritage site but you are not allowed to take photos inside which really annoys me personally. The craft market inside the gate is the best I have seen in Togo and Benin combined.  That said, the road to get here is a disgrace and we have been on some awful roads in this part of world.  It took 5.5 hours to get from Cotonou and the distance is approx 85 miles.

Also the hotels in this area are very low quality.   It is impossible to just go for the day and visit the site so my advice is to wait until Unesco can get the road fixed before you consider going.

title: Brutal!
text:
So if you are lucky enough to have found yourself in Benin, The Royal Palace of Abomey is definitely worth the visit.  This complex of historical palaces traces the history of the Dahomey empire, ancient ancestors of Danzig (little known fact).  The walls of this place are painted in blood and lined with animal bones. There is a mural depicting a wide variety of punishments and tortures, my personal favorite being the clay flute which was shoved up "somebody's bum", as it was translated to us.  Oh, and yeah, there is a THRONE OF SKULLS.  An actual throne, resting on a bed of skulls. Metal.
Also, FYI, it is a very short distance from the taxi park to the museum, probably even walkable, so don't let zemijohns overcharge for the trip.

title: Un lieu authentique pour acheter de l'artisanat.
text: J'adore. Ici, on fabrique les choses que l'on vend, du moins presque toutes. Il est possible de voir les artisans travailler le cuir, le bois, le tissu ou l'argent. Il faut négocier, bien sûr, mais les prix sont raisonnables. L'ambiance est amicale, sans trop d'insistance.

title: Sympathique
text: Habitant à Thiès pour quelques mois, je me rends souvent au village arti. Très globalement, les vendeurs sont très agréables. Il y en a toujours quelques exceptions qui cherchent à imposer des prix élevés. Mais généralement, les vendeurs proposent de bons prix (à condition de négocier un peu  rekk 🙄) ! :)

title: Bustling
text: Elmina’s a bustling fishing town and the castle is at the far end of town. Not a lot going on but an interesting half a day wandering around. The castle is less busy than Cape Coast and fewer tourists. Still impressive and tells a horrific history. Lots of hassle outside but just smile and walk on and all is fine.

title: Very impressive
text: Going there you will be transported in what was the hell for thousands of slaves: you may feel their cries and desperation, really impressive. Guided tour perfectly organised.

title: Excellent tour guides
text:
Very well preserved castle. The tour guides give an excellent potted history of the castle and its role in the slave trade.  
Avoid speaking or even making eye contact with the aggressive even menacing young men hanging around the entrance. They have a number of scams going including forcing you to buy overpriced bracelets.

title: Encore beaucoup de progrès à faire
text: Ca vaut bien entendu le détour lorsque l'on visite le Ghana, mais ce site mérite beaucoup mieux si on le compare avec le Cape Coast Castle qui est bien mieux mis  en valeur - certainement une histoire de financement -

title: Absolutely fascinating
text: Beautiful scenery from the fort, great tour guide, and the fort itself is in very good condition. It gives the visitor a clear glimpse of the living conditions of the slaves at the fort prior to being shipped around the world. If they survived the fort,  70% of them would perish during their sea voyage. The fort is a must see.

title: Als weißer Europäer übt man sich in Demut
text:
Nach Durchquerung des Ortes Elmina erreichen Sie den Parkplatz vor der Festung. Trauen Sie sich, den Hügel hinauf bis unmittelbar vor den Eingang über Plastersteine zu fahren. Dort parken Sie sicher und unbehelligt. Parken Sie weiter unten, zahlen Sie an die omnipräsenten, selbsternannten Parkwächter einen kleinen Obulus (5,00 Cedi).
Der Besuch der Festung führt Sie in die Zellen der dort in Gewahrsam gehaltenen Sklaven, die Empfangsräume des Gouverneurs, die Schlafräume, die Kapelle. Man mag sich nicht ausmalen, wie es damals hier zuging. Allein die Vorstellung der olfaktorischen und sanitären Sensation ist grauenerregend.
Der Besuch der Festung kann nur jedem Reisenden auf das Wärmste empfohlen werden!

title: Very powerful and moving
text: Wonderful tour with great guide, but you have to be careful, as they can be very pushy.  Ask for recommendations from people who have been before.  The fort itself is in pretty good shape and it is amazing to think that it has been in continuous use (by several different gov'ts) over the past 500 years--truly a "living" castle.

title: Sobering but a must see
text: One of the saddest places you will visit. But well worth the visit. Tour guide spoke English well and was very knowledgeable. Important to learn this very sad part of Ghana history

title: Rondleiding door geschiedenis Elmina Castle
text: Door een lokale gids rondgeleid door het Elmina Castle, zeer indrukwekkend! Ondanks de goede gids was het verhaal soms wat lastig te verstaan door de grote groep bezoekers (ong 50 pers per rondleiding)

title: Comprobar la inhumanidad de los humanos
text: Escuchar la historia de las personas de Africa, como los atrapaban y los retenian en estos castillos a lo largo de la costa de Ghana y los tenian amontonados en las cárceles hasta su venta a América.

title: Shopping equo solidale
text: la commessa Elena del negozio dentro il villaggio Bravo Vila do Farol è molto preparata e simpatica. ci ha dato molte informazioni sui prodotti in vendita facenti parte del commercio equosolidale ed in generale sulle isole di capo verde!ho acquistato qualche regalino ed il caffè per moka prodotto artigianalmente a Fogo!ottimo direi! Bravi!

placeInfo.name: Djunta Mo Art
placeInfo.address: Rua 1 de Junho Predio Plaza, Santa Maria, Ilha do Sal 4111 Cape Verde

title: Cool Cape Verdean gifts sources locally!
text:
My wife and I stumbled across this amazing shop, located on the main street in Cape Verde, by chance. Well, it was because my wife had toothache and yes, she was able to buy some local Grogg here and it did help her tooth!

Their mission is definitely "no plastics" and the sustainable gifts come in all shapes and sizes, with not a sign of plastic, mainly made by female entrepreneurs.

We spoke to Elsa on 18 January 2023, who explained that all products and gifts are locally sourced and made in Cape Verde. So they really are pushing a number of the UN SDGs like 
*Nr 5: Gender Equality, 
*Nr 8: Decent work and economic growth, 
*Nr 11: Sustainable cities and communities

Would be a great place to educate your kids (and adults) about these important sustainable goals.

placeInfo.name: Djunta Mo Art
placeInfo.address: Rua 1 de Junho Predio Plaza, Santa Maria, Ilha do Sal 4111 Cape Verde

title: L'autentica Capo Verde
text:
Durante la nostra vacanza a Santa Maria ci è stato consigliato di fare un giro da Djunta Mo Art, un negozietto tipico nel cuore della città che offre prodotti 100% capoverdiani. Una volta entrati non abbiamo potuto non apprezzare il grazioso artigianato esposto nonché il meritevole concetto che lo anima. A ciò si aggiunge la gentilezza delle ragazze del negozio, molto disponibili, attente e sempre sorridenti. Il nostro consiglio è quello di acquistare i vostri souvenir da Djunta Mo Art: ad un prezzo onesto, potrete acquistare pensierini autentici e che fanno del bene alla comunità capoverdiana. E sono talmente belli che non potranno non essere apprezzati da chi li riceverà. In vendita a un costo simbolico troverete anche un libro di suggestivi scatti fotografici dell'Isola di Sal il cui ricavato andrà a sostegno dell'associazione Nu Bai.
Che dire, buono shopping 100% capoverdiano!

title: Vale la pena comprare qui
text:
Vale la pena di comperare qui i propri souvenirs.
Tutto materiale prodotto artigianalmente in loco, con attenzione al lavoro equo e alla valorizzazione delle tradizioni.
Niente paccottiglia africana, che sfrutta le persone per alimentare uno smercio di prodotti di bassa qualità e scarso significato.

placeInfo.name: Djunta Mo Art
placeInfo.address: Rua 1 de Junho Predio Plaza, Santa Maria, Ilha do Sal 4111 Cape Verde

title: Beautiful Product, Extraordinary Service
text: Ordered from abroad. 9 days from Cape Verde to California. The service was incredible, the communication very good, the packaging and delivery swift, and the final product exceeded all of my expectations. I was charmed that the bag with the product was drawn by hand in beautiful script. I ordered online via Facebook chat and paid via paypal. Very easy process. I was even given some photos of the beautiful women artisans who create the "pano de tera" from Gouveia close to Cidade Velha (Santiago Island) So grateful for this treasure which draws me close to the story of a great grandfather who was from Cape Verde, and married my Hawaiian great grandmother. So precious. I look forward to doing business again here. Simply stunning work. So so so grateful!

placeInfo.name: Djunta Mo Art
placeInfo.address: Rua 1 de Junho Predio Plaza, Santa Maria, Ilha do Sal 4111 Cape Verde

title: Un negozio da visitare!! A shop you have to visit!!
text:
Se cercate prodotti tipici di Capo Verde questo negozio a Santa Maria è da visitare. La ragazza che ci ha accolto è stata gentilissima e mai invadente. Ci ha anche fatto assaggiare alcuni liquori del posto alla banana o al frutto della passione. 
Attenzione a tutti gli altri negozi di oggetti importati da altri paesi, che vanno benissimo per carità, ma non sono così caratteristici come quelli di Djunta Mo Art!

If you’re looking for typical products you have to visit this shop in Santa Maria. The girl who talk with us was so gentle. She also let us taste some typical liquors with bananas or passion fruit. 
Be careful to all other shops of imported products, that are ok anyway, but not really made in Cape Verde as the ones of Djunta Mo Art.
